channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2023100472
item.description:
Report E-2023100472

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-18T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XGR experienced a UN1814 ConvoClean Forte release from a 2.5-gallon poly jug. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.25-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the concrete dock floor due to improper handling. Absorbents were deployed by XPO terminal personnel and worked into the impacted area by contractors. The impacted absorbents and damaged jug were then containerized into a 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100449
item.description:
Report E-2023100449

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: OWOSSO
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Pitt Ohio Express
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Upon arrival at the customer delivery location, the tote was discovered to have small crack in the top corner. Very little product was released. A hazmat contractor was called to the scene to transfer the contents into a new tote container. The customer accepted the delivery of the tote. The packaging specs were not able to be obtained as the container was delivered.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and leaking, Proper PPE was used to remove the package from the area and placed into a hazmat bin. Upon inspection we found that one bottle had a loose cap and was leaking. DescribePack: one bottle had a loose cap and was leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Proper PPE was used to remove the package from the area and placed into a hazmat bin.

item.title: Report X-2023090964
item.description:
Report X-2023090964

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: SALINE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to inspect a leaking hazmat package that was sent down the van line sideways. Upon further inspection, it was found that the cap had come loose on one of the bottles of degreaser, causing the contents to leak out. DescribePack: 1 loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA was called to inspect and retrieve the package when damage was discovered.

item.title: Report X-2023080404
item.description:
Report X-2023080404

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: PONTIAC
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Grand Trunk Western Railroad Incorporated
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 1st, 2023, FRA Hazmat Inspector observed a possible vapor leak coming from UTLX 679774. The FRA notified the CN Dangerous Goods Officer. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer responded and observed an audible vapor leak from the manway. An attempt was made to check for loose bolts but all manway bolts were secured tightly. All notifications were made. The CN Dangerous goods Officer vented the car and opened the manway and observed damage to gasket. Gasket appeared to be over compressed and had an obvious tear where the observed leak was. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer replaced the manway gasket with a new gasket. The manway was resecured. The railcar was released onto destination.
